title: Surface characteristics of asphalt pavements with synthetic lightweight aggregate
segmentation: Ladies and gentlemen, good afternoon.
The subject of this presentation is on the surface characteristics of this type of asphalt mix.
Made with expanded clay, which is a synthetic lightweight aggregate will I will explain later in this presentation.
I wish to thank the creators of this paper which are a doctor.
Mcnutt, Obachi, Pietro Leandry Sharp, PhD, PhD, PhD.
Students at in my Department and the local finito.
In their mileage, Akai, which work in the Environment Protection Agency of Tuscany and which have collaborated with this work.
So the outline of this presentation.
First of all, I will introduce the aims of the.
The work and then I will describe the experimental program which has been developed in more steps.
First of all, we had a face of mix design in order to characterize their mix in.

We had some laboratory test to evaluate the mechanical performance of the mix in laboratory and then we use this mix to build an experimental section where to mission surface characteristics of the payment and finally will draw some.
Conclusion.

The use of expanded clay is not new in Italy, it as being there are mean other application of this type of material, but our purpose was to evaluate the potentials of this material to build high performance of wearing layers and in particular we would evaluate their performance of such surface in order to assess their.
Potential as a viable alternative to porous asphalt.

And then we have a neck and external crossed which is very hard and in 10 interior part he has a closed cell.
Photos structure and this is important cause it has a particular effect in the performance of the material by.

Pass column.

By the.
In expanded clay, we replaced the only 50% by weight of the coarse aggregate, which correspond to a about 930% or by volume of the material taking the count difference in.
Wait between natural aggregates and these type of product and the aggregate sites.
Aggregation has been developed taking into account the Italian specification for dense asphalt concrete and also the sharp limits.
And what is interesting to notice that this payment has not been optimized in particular for noise application, because the maximum grain sites is about 12 millimeter.
But we will see later that the payment has a good performance.
From an acoustical point of view.
In order to evaluate the.
Performance in terms of friction, we have carried out to some accelerated polishing test on the matter.
Peter Weir, who can see the three samples, one with the basaltic aggregate, one with the only expanded clay and the other one with the mix in the exact percentage of volume?

And what is important to note is that by using the in the in the mix with the expanded clay, we obtained an increase of 20% of the polishing stone value, and this is important 'cause after polishing them.

Is greater than that required in for normal specification for Italian surface is.

All the surface which is a dense asphalt concrete of the 12 millimeter maximum grain sides and the new payment.

Acoustical properties.

AWOL little action of about 7 DB.
And the same types of results have been obtained also at 80 kilometers per hour, and this variation is due to the beneficial effect of the expanded clay which impacted by by polishing the material.

Looking at the global values of the CP X, we can see that we have a reduction of the five DB from the existing payment and the new payments.

In fact, we have an increase of the resilient models of about 70%.
While on the front of the surface characteristic we have an optimization of the spectrum.
Because we have a fairly low amplitudes in the range of short wavelength and we have we.

In the short of a longer wavelength and you have hag Hamlet dudes in the range of the shorter wavelengths, obviously we can further optimize this texture spectrum by reducing the maximum grain size, because in this case we have had a maximum aggregate size.
It was about 12 millimeter.
By reducing the maximum grain sites at 810 millimeter, we can have further in increase.
In acoustical performance of the material, the friction levels are twice the values required by Italian Italian specification for newly constructed payments.
And the mean CPX index has been reduced of about five DBA compared with the death of the existing payments and and the final.
The acoustical assumption of.

Efficient pick is very low about the .4 and this is important because there not to verify that the payment has a very low effect in terms of acoustical absorption and this is important in order to warrant the.
Duration and over their performance, especially in terms of acoustical performance, I thank you for the attention.
And then I will assign allies you project we are carrying out in Italy the Lopardo project, which is at the third year when it is going to the conclusion.
And then it has been especially focused on the optimization of surface characteristic of payments in order to increase friction and the noise performance.
Thank you for your attention.
